== Completed Specifications ==

* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/desktop-p-xorg|Precise X.org Plans]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[X-Nouveau]]</nowiki> - Transitioning from -nv to -nouveau
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/915resolutions-by-default|915resolutions by default]]</nowiki> - 915resolutions should be automatically installed and configured when -intel is installed
* <nowiki>[[BulletProofX]]</nowiki> - Failsafe mode when X doesn't start, with displayconfig-gtk to configure
* <nowiki>[[CompositeByDefault]]</nowiki> - Switch default window manager from Metacity to Compiz, use Beryl effects
* <nowiki>[[DisplayConfigGTK]]</nowiki> - New GUI utility for configuring Xorg, using the KDE project's <nowiki>[[http://www.kde-apps.org/content/show.php?content=18703|guidance]]</nowiki> for a backend.
* <nowiki>[[LaptopVideoOutputControl]]</nowiki> - automatic plug-and-play projector support
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/monitor-detect-adjust|monitor-detect-adjust]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/redirected-direct-rendering|redirected-direct-rendering]]</nowiki> - requires UXA
* <nowiki>[[Xorg7.3Integration]]</nowiki> - Integrate Xorg 7.3 components, adopt config autodetection
* xorg-intrepid - Informational/Planning session. 
* <nowiki>[[XorgCtrlAltBackspace]]</nowiki> - Disable the Ctrl-Alt-Bksp shortcut.  Needs to build consensus for a solution
* <nowiki>[[X-AutodetectMonitorFrequency]]</nowiki> - Fix remaining resolution issues; rearchitect how video configuration is done.
* <nowiki>[[X-Blueprints-RadeonXaaToExa]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[X-FutureGraphicsTechnology]]</nowiki> - Forecast of upcoming graphics technology changes
* <nowiki>[[X-ImprovingUpstreamingProcess]]</nowiki> - Improving the process for sending bugs upstream
* <nowiki>[[X-InputHotplug]]</nowiki> - Solve #112664, #114469, #134141, #144277, #107876, #42678, #120262
** <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/x-input-redirection|XInputRedirection]]</nowiki> - mouse (and other) input redirection
** <nowiki>[[DesktopTeam-Specs-HardyHardwareDetection]]</nowiki> - Shift to rely on Video and Input hotplug instead of configuring them at install time.
* <nowiki>[[XRoadmap]]</nowiki> - Xorg 7.0, discusses the X modularization and XKB work (for Warty?)
* <nowiki>[[XRoadmapDapper]]</nowiki> - Plans for continuing maintenance of X, Mesa packaging in Dapper
* <nowiki>[[X-Roadmap-Karmic]]</nowiki> - Plans for X work in Karmic
* <nowiki>[[X-TestingInfrastructure]]</nowiki> - Develop components for improving the effectiveness and repeatability of X QA checks and routine testing
* <nowiki>[[X-ProprietaryDrivers-IntegrationImprovements]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[X-OptionsEditor]]</nowiki> - GUI interface for editing xorg.conf settings (i.e. "Advanced Mode" for Screen Resolution) - See xorg-edit-kxgenerator for inspiration
* <nowiki>[[X-Blueprints-Multitouch]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[X-Blueprints-ScreenConfigurationUI]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/desktop-o-xorg-stakeholders-request|Oneiric X.org Plans]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[X-Blueprints-FailsafeX]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[X-Blueprints-TriagingAndDiagnosisTools]]</nowiki>

== Incomplete Specifications ==

These specifications need further discussion and drafting, but could be acceptable for future Ubuntu releases if this is done.

* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/default-font-size|default-font-size]]</nowiki> - proposes setting default font size to 8 and set the rendering to LCD for lcd screens and best shapes for CRTs
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/extend-compiz-3d|extend-compiz-3d]]</nowiki> - give windows a 'depth' attribute
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/gui-mouse-configuration|gui-mouse-configuration]]</nowiki> - GUI for setting up thumb buttons, etc.  Might duplicate MouseExtraButtons spec.
* <nowiki>[[GnomeTouchpadManager]]</nowiki> - GUI tool for defining touchpad preferences
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/extra-function-keys-config-with-keytouch|keyTouch for extra function keys]]</nowiki> - enables user to easily get all extra function keys working
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/login-any-keyboard|login-any-keyboard]]</nowiki> - enables users on same system to share keyboard config selections
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/logitech-g15-keyboard-drivers|logitech-g15-keyboard-drivers]]</nowiki> - G15 debs for Dapper exist; need added to universe
* <nowiki>[[MouseExtraButtons]]</nowiki> - Enable extra buttons present on Microsoft Explorer mice
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/multihead-over-network-gui|multihead-over-network-gui]]</nowiki> - GUI for setting up Xdmx
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/multi-monitor-config|multi-monitor-config]]</nowiki> - <nowiki>[[DisplayConfigGTK]]</nowiki> provides Dual-head, this would extend it to three or more monitors.
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/new-pci-ids|New PCI IDs]]</nowiki> - enable registering new IDs without requiring a kernel update.
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/preferences-drawingtablet-config|preferences-drawingtablet-config]]</nowiki> 
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/report-misdetected-resolution|report-misdetected-resolution]]</nowiki> - need procedure for users to report misconfigured monitors
* <nowiki>[[UbuntuAutomaticKeyboardLayout]]</nowiki> - autoconfigure keyboard layout based on network information using Wheretero
* <nowiki>[[UpToDateAtiNvidiaDrivers]]</nowiki> - Argues in favor of staying closer to bleeding edge for ati and nvidia drivers.  Needs more discussion - there are definite risks/complexities in doing this compared with our current processes.
* <nowiki>[[X-MonitorsDatabaseOnline]]</nowiki> - Enable users to share monitor settings
* <nowiki>[[https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+spec/xorg-alternate-boot|xorg-alternate-boot]]</nowiki> - let user select which xorg.conf to boot from
